### Tender Submission – Waste Water Treatment Plant Contractor Operator

#### Request for Proposal (RFP) 21820-23-0074/A

The Service correctionnel du Canada, Pacific Region, William Head Institution, invites interested contractors to submit a proposal for the provision of Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP) services.

**Contract Details**

* Contract Title: Waste Water Treatment Plant Contractor Operator
* Contract Type: Request for Proposal (RFP)
* Procurement Method: Competitive – Open Bidding
* Contract Value: Estimated
* Contract Period: 08-FEB-2024 to 07-AUG-2024 with the option to renew for 2 additional 6 month periods.

**Statement of Work**

The successful contractor will be required to provide all necessary ongoing operational services and maintenance to the on-site Level III WWTP located at the William Head Federal Correctional Institution in Victoria, British Columbia. The contractor must ensure that the facility operates in a state of efficiency, reliability, and safety.

**Deliverables and Services**

* Provide services in accordance with the Service correctionnel du Canada's Internal Services Directive 318-6 – Management of Wastewater and Wastewater Treatment Systems
* Comply with the Canadian Environmental Protection Act 1999 (CEPA), the Fisheries Act (R.S.C., 1985, ch. F-14), the Waste Water Systems Effluent Regulations (SOR/2012-139), BC Water and Waste Water Association (BCWWA) policies, the Code of Ethics and Standards of Practice of the Environmental Operators Certification Program of B.C. and Yukon (EOCP) and all other relevant municipal, provincial, and federal bylaws, regulations, and legislation applicable to the work

**Eligibility and Conditions**

* Not subject to any set-asides for Indigenous Suppliers
* Not subject to a Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement
* No security requirements

**Evaluation Criteria**

* Lowest priced compliant bid

**Submission Instructions**

* Proposals must be submitted in either English or French
* Tender documents can be downloaded from the Canada buys / tender opportunities website
* Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process within 15 working days of receipt of the results.
